channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to know about Jared Isaacman, the billionaire private astronaut leading NASA

item.title: Austrian nuns await word from the Vatican on whether they can stay in their convent
item.description: The three octogenarian nuns broke out of a nursing home to go back to live in their convent, sparking a dispute with their church superior. Both sides...

item.title: Inflation cools slightly in November as worries about affordability grip Americans
item.description: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase...

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

item.title: Pickle Robot adds Tesla veteran as first CFO
item.description: Jeff Evanson recently joined Pickle Robot as the company's first CFO as the startup has allegedly expanded its partnership with UPS.

item.title: Instacart to pay $60M to settle FTC claims it deceived consumers
item.description: The federal agency alleged Instacart misled consumers with unlawful tactics, causing them to pay higher fees while also denying refunds.

item.title: ChatGPT’s mobile app hits new milestone of $3B in consumer spending
item.description: ChatGPT has reached $3B in lifetime mobile consumer spending in just 31 months, faster than TikTok and major streaming apps.

item.title: Why British politicians are flocking to American tech giants

item.title: Police are investigating link between Brown shooting and killing of MIT professor, AP sources say
item.description: Authorities are investigating a connection between the mass hooting at Brown University and the killing of an MIT professor two days later.
